intro: Rubus contractiflorus, commonly known as the narrow-flower blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in moist, woodland habitats and is often found in the understory of forests. Botanically, it is part of the Rubus genus, which includes many species of brambles and blackberries.
